title: W3.CSS Quotes

metadata.description: Learn about W3.CSS Quotes with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:

Displaying Quotes The w3-panel class is the perfect class to display quotes. Quotes are often displayed with a grey background, a left border bar, and an italic font style: "Make it as simple as possible, but not simpler." Albert Einstein Example

"Make it as simple as possible, but not simpler."

Albert Einstein

Large Quotes Large quotes are often used on the Internet: "Make it as simple as possible, but not simpler." Albert Einstein Example

"Make it as simple as possible, but not simpler."

Albert Einstein

Blockquotes If you use the standard HTML
element, notice that the browser will add an extra left and right margin: "Make it as simple as possible, but not simpler." Albert Einstein Example

"Make it as simple as possible, but not simpler."

Albert Einstein

quiz.question:
What is panel
class?
options: often displayed with a grey background
the perfect class to display quotes
quiz.explanation:
The correct definition of panel
class is 'the perfect class to display quotes'.

quiz.question: What is Quotes?
options: the perfect class to display quotes
often displayed with a grey background
quiz.explanation: The correct definition of Quotes is 'often displayed with a grey background'.

summary: This tutorial covers W3.CSS Quotes concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use W3.CSS Quotes effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of W3.CSS Quotes and how to apply it in your projects.
